thread.title: Apple Music has 6.5 million paid subscribers
thread.title_full: Apple Music has 6.5 million paid subscribers - SFGate

author: sfgate.com
title: Apple Music has 6.5 million paid subscribers
text:
Apple Music already has 6.5 million paid subscribers, or about a third of the 20 million who pay for industry rival Spotify, after only four months on the market, according to Apple Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook , who spoke at a conference Monday night.
The company has 8.5 million additional customers using the service’s three-month trial subscription.
Cook appeared at a technology conference in Laguna Beach (Orange County) sponsored by the Wall Street Journal .
For comparison, music-streaming leader Spotify has 55 million people using its ad-supported free service, which has been around since 2008.
Apple Music offered three months of the service for free. Those who continue after their trial periods end pay $10 a month for individual accounts or $15 a month for family plans.
In August, Apple said 11 million people had tried the service, and trial periods began to expire at the end of September. Since then, the music industry has been eagerly awaiting Apple’s subscriber numbers, while the company’s executives have made various public statements that they were aware of early problems with the service — like jumbled playlists — and were working to resolve them.
According to FBR Capital Markets analyst Daniel Ives , Apple Music, which was introduced at the end of June, is off to a “solid start,” and he would “characterize this initial stage of the launch as a ‘triple’ in the streaming ballgame.”
The service’s success shouldn’t come as a surprise, though. Any iPhone that was upgraded to iOS 8.4 automatically had Apple Music installed, and the service also comes on all newer iPhones sold in stores. In the first quarter of 2015, the company sold 74.5 million iPhones.
In addition to music streaming, Apple Music also offers the Beats 1 around-the-clock radio station, curated playlists and a “connect” feature that lets users follow artists, who then share with fans special content such as new songs and behind-the-scenes photos.
Spotify last revealed its user numbers in June, when it said it had 20 million paying users around the world and another 55 million who use its advertising-supported free version.
